interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: American Horror Story: Season 1 Review Date: 2012/12/29 Store: Connie Britton (Actor), Dylan McDermott (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Television Product Description: ["Brace yourself for an addictive thrill ride! American Horror Story is TV's most original new drama, a deeply stylish psychosexual haunt devised to keep you on the edge of your seat. The Harmon's (Dylan McDermott, Connie Britton) fresh start in a new home deviously twists to reveal discoveries of love, sex and murderous revenge. Featuring a Golden Globe(R) -winning performance by Jessica Lange, Season One scares up a host of engrossing extras."] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television, Horror/Television', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Dylan McDermott, Connie Britton', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 4.96 Ounces', 'Item model number': '4608409810465', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '8 hours and 54 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 25, 2012', 'Actors': 'Connie Britton, Dylan McDermott', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English, French', 'Studio': 'FX', 'Number of discs': '4'} Review Text: Why did Moira O'Hara age after her death? None of the other characters aged. And she became two characters of different age while other characters stayed at the age and level of maturity they were when they died.

And everybody else kept their death wounds. Young Moira was shot through the right eye. Old Moira had that bum eye, but young Moira had both eyes.

This is Really Important. Or not. Review Title: One question... Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Arrival [Blu-ray] Ron Silver (Actor), Charlie Sheen (Actor), David N. Twohy (Director), David Twohy (Director) & 1 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Mystery & Thrillers ['Zane Ziminski is an astrophysicist who receives a message that seems to have extraterrestrial origins. Eerily soon after his discovery, Zane is fired. He then embarks on a search to determine the origins of the transmission that leads him into a Hitchcockian labyrinth of paranoia and intrigue.'] {'Genre': 'Mystery', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Blu-ray, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Original recording remastered, WidescreenMultiple Formats, AC-3, Blu-ray, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Widescreen See more', 'Contributor': 'David N. Twohy, Catalina Botello, Phyllis Applegate, Roger Cudney, Tony Johnson, David Twohy, Ron Silver, Ángel de la Peña, Thomas Smith, Richard Schiff, Alan Coates, Leon Rippy, Javier Morga, Jorge Becerril, Luisa Huertas, Dave Galasso, James Steele, Alejandro Usigli, Shane, Jorge Zepeda, Andrea Sisniega, Monica Dionne, Maria Coronel, David Villalpando, Charlie Sheen, Jacqueline Voltaire, Ellen Bradley, José Garcia, Buddy Joe Hooker, Georg Lillitsch, Teri Polo, Ree Johnson, Lindsay CrouseDavid N. Twohy, Catalina Botello, Phyllis Applegate, Roger Cudney, Tony Johnson, David Twohy, Ron Silver, Ángel de la Peña, Thomas Smith, Richard Schiff, Alan Coates, Leon Rippy, Javier Morga, Jorge Becerril, Luisa Huertas, Dave Galasso, James Steele, Alejandro Usigli, S… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': 'LGT25338BR', 'Director': 'David N. Twohy, David Twohy', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Blu-ray, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 21, 2009', 'Actors': 'Ron Silver, Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Crouse, Richard Schiff, Shane', 'Producers': 'James Steele, Thomas Smith', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} I saw this by accident on FiOS. What a stinker. Plot is awful. Characters thin. Effects cheesy. "Sets" phony. The very idea of buying this on Blu-ray is laughable. Sheen is a joke. He should stick to what he knows: one-line sex jokes, hookers and beating up his wives.

This is a third world-produced "film" that should have gone straight to video that I'd perhaps buy used for $1 at a garage sale, and then throw away to save space. This makes Plan 9 From Outer Space look plausible.

Man am I glad I saw it on a backwater channel and didn't put any money out on this turkey, even as a rental. There is no doubt why it failed at the box office. It would have failed at 2:00 AM on Syfy channel.

If this is what passes for good sci-fi, y'all have a pretty low threshold for quality. Stinker American Horror Story: Season 1 Connie Britton (Actor), Dylan McDermott (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Television ["Brace yourself for an addictive thrill ride! profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preferences:** The user has a clear preference for high-quality movies, particularly in the Mystery and Thriller genres. They continue to engage with television series, especially those that delve into horror and psychological themes.

- **Critical Viewpoint:** The user remains highly discerning and often critiques plot inconsistencies and character development, as evidenced by their recent review, which highlights a notable narrative flaw in a popular series.

- **Entertainment Consumption:** Historically cautious about financial investments in media, the user shows flexibility by purchasing a well-rated television series. They seem to weigh the perceived quality and popular acclaim before committing, suggesting a shift toward considering critically acclaimed content.

- **Rating Tendencies:** The user rates films and shows with a critical eye, often assigning low ratings when unsatisfied. However, they have rated their recent viewing experience more generously, indicating a potential for more nuanced ratings based on overall production quality.

- **General Attitude:** The user maintains a sarcastic and humorous tone in their critiques, indicating a blend of appreciation for quality storytelling and a willingness to express dissatisfaction when expectations are not met.

Overall, this user values quality cinematic and television experiences and demonstrates an evolving approach to content purchasing, balancing critical expectations with recognition of popular acclaim.
